title: (x) Handwritten fonts with alternates? - various {gang}
content:
I'm looking for a good handwritten font with alternate versions of characters for a project that I'm currently working on. I've read through the discussion of [favorite handwritten fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018065913/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/14521.html) from back in August, but I think I'm looking for something a little more specific.   
   
What I'm looking for is something that possibly has the feel of [Ingrid Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018065913/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/enrich/ingrid-font/) but with the functionality and alternates that [Caflisch Script Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018065913/http:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/P/P_1725.jhtml) has. But, most specifically, I'd take any handwritten font as long as it has some good alternate characters.   
   
Can anyone help? Thanks!
author: andyclymer

comments.content:
Tiffany --   
   
Good call, I havent seen Handsome yet. The only thing is that I'd love to use a typeface that has a couple versions of each character (or at least the caps) in each weight to keep it looking more natural and less repetitive.   
   
Thanks for the suggestion though

Or [LHF Stanford Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018065913/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letterheadfonts/lhf-stanford-script/) has alternates. Looks like   
the alts are lc only. See the Character Map.
Go to Fontshop.com they have a whole section of their catalog devoted to handwritten fonts. Dan
I think I'm leaning towards LHF Stanford Script. Thanks everyone
Hmm. Have you looked at Shinntype's [Handsome](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018065913/http:/www.shinntype.com/)?
